title: Food History + Local Markets Tour & Fruit Tasting
description: Learn what‚Äôs trendy, not touristy, on this small-group food history tour of Lima. You‚Äôll mingle with the locals at two colorful markets then head over to the Barranco District, a bohemian enclave of Peruvian cuisine. Your guide will introduce you to tasty, and safe-to-eat, street food. With just seven people max, it‚Äôs ideal for families.
all_descriptions: Learn what‚Äôs trendy, not touristy, on this small-group food history tour of Lima. You‚Äôll mingle with the locals at two colorful markets then head over to the Barranco District, a bohemian enclave of Peruvian cuisine. Your guide will introduce you to tasty, and safe-to-eat, street food. With just seven people max, it‚Äôs ideal for families.

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productStop At:Mercado N 2 de Surquillo, Contralmirante Montero 761, Lima 15047 PeruWe will begin our adventure in this colorful and friendly local market in Surquillo district. Be ready to taste different kinds of exotics fruits, coming from different parts of the country like the coast, the jungle and the Andes. We can also choose between trying a delicious Causa or a fresh Ceviche.Duration: 45 minutesStop At:Santiago de Surco, Lima PeruAfter tasting different samples of food in the earlier market now we arrive at Santiago de Surco Market. Its reputation is well-known among people who have a great interest in rainforest food and fresh exotic fruit juices. So, this will be a good opportunity to try a delicious ‚ÄúJuane‚Äù or ‚ÄúChaufa de Cecina‚Äù typical dishes from the forest prepared with authentic and organic ingredients from the Amazon.

Get ready to have one of the most amazing experience, full of surprises, trying the flavors of Peru along the time and listening to the history behind the different dishes we try along the tour.Duration: 40 minutesStop At:Jr. Garc√≠a y Garc√≠a 940, Lima 15049, PeruThe Ugarelli vineyard located in Surco, is one of the few that still maintains its customs, traditions and cultural fervor.

Ugarelli is dedicated to the production of young dry, semi-dry and sweet wines. On the other hand, the production of Pisco and Macerated wines is almost an obligation for a Peruvian winery.

During the visit, you'll have the opportunity to taste a variety of flavors that reflect the richness and passion of this winemaking tradition.Duration: 30 minutes
Av. Jos√© Larco 724, Miraflores 15074, PeruDear client, if you don't want pick up, you can meet us at our office located at Av. Jose Larco 724, Miraflores.
End:This activity ends back at the meeting point.

Great experience!

Sep 2025 ‚Ä¢ Couples
This was a lovely and informative tour of the local market - which sells practically everything - with advice and many tastings. Then we went to the kitchen and cooked 3 different Peruvian dishes - which we also ate. Cesar is funny and helpful, and Carina showed us how to make all the dishes. You will be full at the end so arrive hungry! I woukd recommend the tour
Written September 24, 2025

Excellent experience tasting typical fruits and foods

Sep 2025 ‚Ä¢ Family
Excellent experience eating typical Peruvian foods in Lima markets such as ceviche, chaufa with fish, and tropical fruits such as chirimoya, granadilla, tumbo, pitaya, lucuma and aguaymanto. We end up taking a walk in the neighborhood of Barranco. Very didactic the explanations of Gaby our guide and excellent driver driving Cyril.

Tasty treats & local beats

Sep 2025 ‚Ä¢ Friends
We were VERY BLESSED to have Leonardo for both days. We toured the historical district with the presidential mansion & the church in the town center. Leonardo was vibrant, knowledgeable and a true pleasure to have as a guide. On the food tour he was happy to help us with adjustments, played local music for us while riding to the next stop and answered all our questions with enthusiasm. TOP NOTCH GUIDE!!!

Incredible learning and eating across Lima and Per√∫!

Jun 2025 ‚Ä¢ Solo
Leonardo and his amazing energy, passion to share about Peruvian culture, food, and language were phenomenal. We tried foods from all regions of Per√∫, the historical significance as well as the contemporary impact. To learn about the family histories making the foods for 40, 50 or 100 years was also inspirational. Leonardo created a comfy, cohesive group vibe, really important, and was a great teammate with our driver. I appreciated learning more Peruvian phrases as well! You can‚Äôt learn and do this much on one‚Äôs own in the time we had, totally recommend this to dig deeper and take away greater understanding y appreciation about what, why, how, and when we eat what we do - en Per√∫!
